intro: Junellia toninii, commonly known as the Toninii's junellia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Junellia toninii is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
